question:
A Company ismigrating to the AWS Cloud Instead of running its infrastructure On Premise. Which of the
following are advantages‘of this migration? (Choose two)
options: Elimination of the need to perform security auditing
Ability to Deploy globally in minutes
Elimination of the cost of IT staff members
Redundancy by default for all compute services
explanation: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud- computing.html
correct_answers: Ability to Deploy globally in minutes

question:
Acompany needs significant cost savings for their non-interruptible workloads on AWS.
Which EC2 instancepricing model should the company select?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances (RI) provide a significant discount (up to 72%) compared to On- Demand pricing and provide a capacity reservation when used in a specific Availability Zone. https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/reserved-instances/

question:
Which Componentof the AWS global Infrastructure is made up of one or more discrete data centers that
have redundant power , networking and connectivity?
explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region. All AZs in an AWS Region are interconnected with high-bandwidth, low-latency networking, over fully redundant, dedicated metro fiber providing high-throughput, low-latency networking between AZs. All traffic between AZs is encrypted. AZs are physically separated by a meaningful distance, many kilometers, from any other AZ, although all are within 100 km (60 miles) of each other.

question:
What is the most cost-effective Amazon S3 storage tier for data that is not often accessed but requires high
availability?
explanation: $3 Standard-IA is for data that is accessed less frequently, but requires rapid access when needed. S3 Standard-IA offers the high durability, high throughput, and low latency of S3 Standard, with a low per GB storage price and per GB retrieval charge. It is Designed for 99.9% availability over a given year. https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/

question:
A company wants to migrate a critical application to AWS. The application has a short runtime. The
application is invoked by changes in data or by shifts in system state. The company needs a compute solution
that maximizes operational efficiency and minimizes the cost of running the application.

Which AWS solution/should the company use to meet these requirements?
options: Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances jC. AWSLambda
explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless, event-driven compute service that lets you run code for virtually any type of application or backend service without provisioning or managing servers. You can trigger Lambda from over 200 AWS services and software as a service (SaaS) applications, and only pay for what you use.

question:
Which AWS Service or feature can a company use to determine which business unit is using specific AWS

resources?
options: Key Pairs ¥ D. AWS Trusted Advisor
explanation: You can use tags to organize your resources, and cost allocation tags to track your AWS costs on a detailed level: After you activate cost allocation tags, AWS uses the cost allocation tags to organize your resource costs on your cost allocation report, to make it easier for you to categorize and track your AWS costs.

question:
Which of the following task requires using AWS account root user credentials?
— A. Changing the AWS support plan
] B. Starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances
f C. Opening an AWS ‘support case
explanation: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html

question: Which statement is correct in relation to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?
options: AWS is responsible for encrypting customer data
Customers/are responsible for patching and fixing flaws within the infrastructure
explanation: ‘CUSTOMER DATA CUSTOMER PLATFORM, APPLICATIONS, IDENTITY & ACCESS MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBLITY FOR SecuRrTy ‘br THE LOUD OPERATING SYSTEM, NETWORK & FIREWALL CONFIGURATION
correct_answers: Customers/are responsible for patching and fixing flaws within the infrastructure

question: Which of the following are architectural best practices for the AWS Cloud? (Choose two)
explanation: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/apn/the-6-pillars-of-the-aws-well-architected-framework/

question:
An organization has an on-premise environment which they want to connect to their AWS environment.

How can they achieve this Hybrid Cloud configuration which avoids using Internet?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a network service that provides an alternative to using the Internet to utilize AWS cloud services. AWS Direct Connect enables customers to have low latency, secure and private connections to AWS for workloads which require higher speed or lower latency than the internet.

question:
A company wants its workloads to be resilient, perform correctly, consistently, and recover from errors in a
timely mannerias part ofits Cloud Architecture. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework are
these requirements related to?
explanation: The Reliability pillar encompasses the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently when it’s expected to. There are five design principles for reliability in the cloud: * Automatically recover from failure * Test recovery procedures e Scale horizontally to increase aggregate workload availabilitv

question:
A company needs to simultaneously process hundreds of requests from different users. Which combination

of AWS services should the company-use to build an operationally efficient solution?
options: AWS Data Pipeline and Amazon EC2
explanation: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/with-sqs.html

question:
What is the Scope of a VPC within the AWS Network?
—> A. AVPC can span all availability zones within an AWS Region
options: AVPC can span all availability zones within an AWS Region
AVPC can span all availability zones globally
AVPC must span at least 2 subnets in each AWS Region
AVPC must span at least 2 edge locations in each AWS Region
explanation: https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/faqs/
correct_answers: AVPC can span all availability zones within an AWS Region

question:
What responsibility does a customer have when using Amazon RDS to host a database according to AWS
shared responsibility model?

What is the benefit of using fully managed services in AWS compared to deploying 3rd party software on
EG@2?
options: You don’t need to backup your data
You have greater control and flexibility
explanation: Fully managed services reduce your operational overhead as AWS manage not just the infrastructure layer but the service layers above it as well. One of the examples is Amazon Aurora.

question: Which AWS services are delivered globally and not regionally? (Choose two)
explanation: AWS services process and store customer content in the AWS region(s) where the services are used by the customer. Except as otherwise specified, Global Services—AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), AWS Organizations, Amazon CloudFront, Amazon Route53, AWS Global Accelerator, AWS Direct Connect, AWS Firewall Manager, AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF), and AWS Shield—may store and process data globally.

question:
Which AWS service is used to enable Multi-factor authentication?
oe AL AWS IAM
explanation: AWS multifactor authentication (MFA) is an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) best practice that requires a second authentication factor in addition to user name and password sign-in credentials. You can enable MFA at the AWS account level and for root and IAM users you have created in youraccount.

question: What is the Most Secure method when storing passwords on AWS?.
options: Store Passwords in AWS Secrets Manager.
Store Passwords.in an Amazon S3 Bucket.
explanation: AWS Secrets Manager helps you manage, retrieve, and rotate database credentials, API keys, and other secrets throughout their lifecycles. https://aws.amazon.com/secrets-manager/ Note: AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) lets you create, manage, and control cryptographic keys and not the user credentials.
correct_answers: Store Passwords in AWS Secrets Manager.

question: Which of the following are the components of AWS Site-to-Site VPN Connection? (Choose two)
explanation: A Site-to-Site VPN-connection offers two VPN tunnels between a virtual private gateway or a transit gateway on the AWS side, and a customer gateway (which represents a VPN device) on the remote (on-premises) side. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpn/latest/s2svpn/VPC_VPN.html

question:
Which storage type can be mounted using the NFS protocol to many EC2 instances simultaneously?
} A. Amazon EBS
explanation: : fittps://docs.aws.amazon.com/efs/latest/ug/how-it-works.html

question:
Which AWS Service or feature acts as a firewall for Amazon EC2 Instances?
— A. Security Group
explanation: A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your EC2 instances to control incoming and outgoing traffic. Inbound rules control the incoming traffic to your instance, and outbound rules control the outgoing traffic from your instance.

question:
Asystem engineer discovers that several Amazon EC2 instances have been terminated. Which AWS service
should the system engineer use to identify the user or AWS API call that terminated these instances?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail is an AWS service that helps you enable operational and risk auditing, governance, and compliance of your AWS account. Actions taken by a user, role, or an AWS service are recorded as events in CloudtTrail

question: Which AWS service will help protect applications running on AWS against DDoS attacks?
explanation: AWS Shield is a managed DDoS protection service that safeguards applications running on AWS. It provides dynamic detection and automatic inline mitigations that minimize application downtime and latency, so there is no need to engage AWS Support to benefit from DDoS protection. There are two tiers of AWS Shield: Standard and Advanced.

question:
A Company has a single Amazon EC2 Instance. The company wants to adopt a highly available architecture.
What can the company do to meet this requirement?
options: Change the EC2 instance family to a compute optimized instance.
Scale horizontally across multiple Availability Zones. ' Scale vertically-to a larger EC2 instance Size.
explanation: Horizontal scaling, commonly referred to as scale-out, is the capability to automatically add systems/instances in a distributed manner in order to handle an increase in load. Examples of this increase in load could be the increase of number of sessions to a web application. With horizontal scaling, the load is distributed across multiple instances. By distributing these instances across Availability Zones, horizontal scaling not only increases performance, but also improves the overall reliability.
correct_answers: Scale horizontally across multiple Availability Zones. ' Scale vertically-to a larger EC2 instance Size.

question:
AWS has the ability to achieve lower pay-as-you-go pricing by aggregating usage across hundreds of
thousands of users. This describes which advantage of the AWS Cloud?
explanation: By using cloud computing, you can achieve a lower variable cost than you can get on your own. Because usage from hundreds of thousands of customers is aggregated in the cloud, providers such as AWS can achieve higher economies of scale, which translates into lower pay as-you-go prices.

question: Which AWS Service can be used to track configuration history of your AWS resources?
explanation: AWS Config records details of changes to your AWS resources to provide you with a configuration history: You can use the AWS Management Console, API, or CLI to obtain details of what a resource’s configuration looked like at any point in the past. https://aws.amazon.com/config/

question: Which of the following Security related activities are the responsibility of AWS customers? (Choose two)
options: Installing Patches on the guest Operating System
explanation: Customer is responsible for “Security in the Cloud” and AWS is responsible for “Security of the Cloud”
correct_answers: Installing Patches on the guest Operating System

question:
Which of the following is one of the major benefits of using Elastic Cloud Compute over your traditional on-
premise physical servers?
options: You can choose the hardware vendor
You get root access to the server
You only pay for what you use
You have the facility of automated backups
correct_answers: You only pay for what you use

question: Which of the following are features of Network ACL in AWS Cloud? (Choose two)
options: They operate at the Instance level.
They evaluate all_rules before allowing traffic.
They process rules in order starting with lowest numbered rule when deciding whether to allow traffic
explanation: Network ACLs are stateless, which means that responses to allowed inbound traffic are subject to the rules for outbound traffic (and vice versa). Rules are evaluated starting with the lowest numbered rule. As soon as a rule matches traffic, it's applied regardless of any higher-numbered rule that might contradict it. A network ACL has inbound rules and outbound rules. Each rule can either allow or deny traffic.
correct_answers: They operate at the Instance level.

question:
A company is planning to store their archives in AWS. Which of the following storage mechanism provided by
AWS would providean ideal and cost-efficient storage option for storing the archive data?
= A. Amazon S3 Glacier
explanation: The Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes are purpose-built for data archiving, providing you with the highest performance, most retrieval flexibility, and the lowest cost archive storage in the cloud. All S3 Glacier storage classes provide virtually unlimited scalability and are designed for 99.999999999% (11 nines) of data durability. https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/glacier/

question:
A company wants to have access to scalable, highly reliable, and fully managed file storage
that runs on the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol. Which AWS service will meet these
requirements?
options: protocol. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
Amazon FSx for Windows File Server
explanation: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server makes it easy for you to launch and scale reliable, performant, and secure shared file storage for your applications and end users. With Amazon FSx, you can launch highly durable and available file systems that can span multiple availability zones (AZs) and can be accessed from up to thousands of compute instances using the industry- etandard Server Maccagea Rioarck (SMR) nrotacol

question:
A company wants to improve the overall availability and performance of its applications that are hosted on
AWS. Which AWS service'should the company use?
explanation: AWS Global Accelerator is a networking service that helps you improve the availability, performance, and security of your public applications. Global Accelerator provides two global static public IPs that act as a fixed entry point to your application endpoints, such as Application Load Balancers, Network Load Balancers, Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances, and elastic IPs

question:
You have been running an on-demand Amazon Linux EC2 instance for 8 hours, 9 minutes and 17 seconds.
How much time will you be billed for?
explanation: EC2 usage is billed.in one-second increments, with a minimum of 60 seconds. Per-second billing is available for instances launched in: 1. On-Demand, Savings Plans, Reserved, and Spot instances

question:
Acompany has many multiple business units using the same AWS services to manage their different
applications. WhichAWS’service or tool can the company use to receive volume discounts across multiple
AWS accounts?
explanation: https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

question:
Your application is hosted on Amazon EC2 instances. CPU and RAM requirements of the application rapidly
change when batchjobs execute. Which AWS service can be used’ to dynamically adjust those resources
based on demand?
options: Amazon Route53 mB. EC2 Auto Scaling
explanation: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/ec2/userguide/scale-your-group.html

question:
Acompany has a 3+tier application hosted in AWS. The architecture consists of a web , application and
database tier. Which of the following AWS services can be used to monitor this architecture?
== A. AWS CloudWatch
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch collects and visualizes real-time logs, metrics, and event data in automated dashboards to streamline your infrastructure and application maintenance. It allows you to collect and store logs in near real time. https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/

question:
Which AWS security service can be used to detect users personal credit card numbers from data stored in a
S3 bucket?
J , A. Amazon Macie
explanation: Amazon Macie is a data security service that uses machine learning (ML) and pattern matching to discover and help protect your sensitive data. Amazon Macie continually evaluates your Amazon S3 environment and provides a summary of your data security posture across all of your accounts. You Can search, filter, and sort S3 buckets by metadata variables, such as bucket names, tags, and security controls like encryption status or public accessibility.

question:
A Customer requires a dedicated Technical Account Manager (TAM) to support them during critical issues
regarding various AWS Services. Which Support plan. should they purchase?

Aweb administrator maintains several public and private web-based resources for an organization.
Which service can they use to keep track of the expiry dates of SSL/TLS certificates as well as updating and
renewal?
explanation: AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) can be used to provision, manage, and deploy public and private SSL/TLS.certificates for use with AWS services and your internal connected resources. ACM removes the time-consuming manual process of purchasing, uploading, and renewing SSL/TLS certificates. https://aws.amazon.com/certificate-manager/

question:
Your company wants to move an existing Oracle database to the AWS Cloud. Which of the following
services can help facilitate this move?
_~ A. AWS Database Migration Service
explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) is a managed migration and replication service that helps move your database and analytics workloads to AWS quickly, securely, and with minimal downtime and zero data loss. AWS DMS supports migration between 20-plus database and analytics engines. https://aws.amazon.com/dms/

question:
A large enterprise with multiple VPC’s in several AWS Regions around the world needs to connect and
centrally manage network connectivity between its VPG’s. Which-AWS service or feature meets these
requirements?
options: AWS Transit Gateway "rr C.. VPC endpoints
explanation: AWS. Transit Gateway enables customers to connect thousands of VPCs. You can attach all your hybrid connectivity (VPN and Direct Connect connections) to a single Transit Gateway instance, consolidating and controlling your organization's entire AWS routing configuration in one place.
correct_answers: AWS Transit Gateway "rr C.. VPC endpoints

question:
A Company islaunching an application in AWS Cloud. The application will use Amazon S3 storage and a large
team of researchers will have shared-access to the data: The company must be able to recover data that is
accidentally overwritten or deleted. Which AWS feature-can the company use to meet this requirement?
explanation: Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket. You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets. With versioning you can recover more easily from both Wh ie ge RL ee yp a he a

question:
Which of the following needs to be included in Total cost of Ownership (TCO) Analysis? (Choose two)
~~ A. Data Center Security Costs
explanation: Consider the following elements affecting cost while calculating TCO: ** Data Center facilities ¢ Hardware and infrastructure ¢ Software ¢ Disaster recovery ¢ Security

question:
A Company needs to install an application in a Docker container. Which AWS service eliminates the need to

provision and manage container hosts?
options: Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) “-—— C. AWS Fargate
Amazon FSx for Windows File Server
explanation: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that works with both Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) and Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS). AWS Fargate makes it easy to focus on building your applications. Fargate eliminates the need to provision and manage servers, lets you specify and pay for resources per application, and improves security through application isolation by design.
correct_answers: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

question:
A Company Wants to have up to date information on the AWS Service availability. Where can they find this

information?
explanation: You can use the AWS Health Dashboard — Service health to view the health of all AWS services. This page shows reported service events for services across AWS Regions. You don't need to sign in or have an AWS.account to access the AWS Health Dashboard — Service health page (https://health,aws.amazon.com/health/status)

question:
The Developers in a large organization want to use an IDE to run, test and debug code for Lambda functions.

Which AWS service is the most appropriate?
explanation: AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that lets you write, run, and debug your code with just a browser. It includes a code editor, debugger, and terminal. Cloud9 comes prepackaged with essential tools for popular programming languages, including JavaScript, Python, PHP, and more, so you don’t need to install files or configure your development machine to start new projects. Since your Cloud9 IDE is cloud-based, you can work on your projects from your office, home, or anywhere using an internet-connected machine.

question:
A group of Non Tech friends are looking to setup a website for an upcoming event at a cost-effective price
with a friendly interface. Which AWS:service is the most.appropriate to use?
= A. Use AWS LightSail
options: Use AWS Marketplace to install a ready-made WordPress AMI
Download/a pre-configured website on EC2 instance from a third party website
Use a pre-configured customizable Apache web server on an EC2 Instance
explanation: AWS LightSail can be used to Build website in just a few clicks, with pre-configured applications like WordPress, Magento, Prestashop, and Joomla. Lightsail automatically configures networking, access, and security environments, taking the guesswork out of launching your server. You can also install additional software on your instances by using the in-browser SSH or your own SSH client. https://aws:amazon.com/lightsail/

question: Service Control Policies (SCPs) manage permission for which of the following?
explanation: Service control policies (SCPs) are a type of organization policy that you can use to manage permissions in your organization.

question:
A Company wants to convert audio and video files from their source format into a format that will play on
smartphones, tablets and web browsers. Which AWS service can.be used to meet these requirements?
explanation: Amazon Elastic Transcoder is media transcoding in the cloud. It is designed to be a highly scalable, easy to use and a cost effective way for developers and businesses to convert (or “transcode”) media files from their source format into versions that will playback on devices like smartphones, tablets and PCs.

question:
Which AWS service supports a hybrid architecture that gives users the ability to extend AWS infrastructure,
AWS services, APIs and tools to data centers, co-location environments, or on-premises facilities?
options: AWS Local Zones “— C. AWS Outposts
explanation: AWS Outposts is a family of fully managed solutions delivering AWS infrastructure and services to virtually any on-premises or edge location for a truly consistent hybrid experience. https://aws.amazon.com/outposts/

question: Which AWS service lets you convert text into speech?
explanation: Amazon Polly uses deep learning technologies to synthesize natural-sounding human speech, so you can convert articles to speech. With dozens of lifelike voices across a broad set of languages, use Amazon Polly to build speech-activated applications. Amazon Polly provides an API that enables vou to guicklv integrate speech svnthesis into vour application.

question:
Which AWS service or tool can be used to capture information about inbound and outbound traffic in an
Amazon VPC?
~~ A. VPC Flow Logs
explanation: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. Flow log data can be published to the following locations: Amazon CloudWatch Logs, Amazon S3, or Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose. You can create a flow log for a. VPC, a subnet, or a network interface. If you create a flow log for a subnet or VPC, each network interface in that subnet or VPC is monitored.

question: Which AWS service provides a managed software version control system?
explanation: AWS CodeCommitis a secure, highly scalable, fully managed source control service that hosts private Git repositories. https://aws.amazon.com/codecommit/

question:
Which of the following AWS services can be used to provide root storage volumes to Amazon EC2 Instances?
> A. Amazon EBS
explanation: You.can launch an EC2 instance from either an instance store-backed AMI or an Amazon EBS- backed AMI.

question:
An IAM user must be granted access to an Amazon S3 bucket using a bucket policy. Which element in the S3
bucket policy should be updated to define the user account for which access will be granted ?
explanation: You can use the Principal element in a resource-based JSON policy to specify the principal that is allowed or denied access to a resource. You can specify any of the principals in the policy including AWS account, root user, IAM roles, IAM users, AWS services.

question: In which situationsshould a company create an IAM user instead of an IAM role ? (Choose two)
options: When usersjare authenticated in the corporate network and want to be able to use AWS without having to sign in a second time.
When an application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances requires access to other AWS services.
When'the company needs to add users to IAM groups.
When the company creates AWS access credentials for individuals.
When the company creates an application that runs on a mobile phone that makes requests to AWS.
correct_answers: When'the company needs to add users to IAM groups.
When the company creates AWS access credentials for individuals.

question: Which of the following is the best practice for managing AWS IAM access keys?
options: There is no need-to manage access keys.
AWS rotates access keys on a schedule.
Use IAM roles instead of access keys.
Customer should rotate the access keys regularly.
explanation: Access keys give IAM users the ability to connect to Amazon EC2 instances. Therefore rotating these regularly (for example, every 90 days) is one of the key steps in protecting your resources from unauthorized access. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/credentials-access-keys-best- practices.html
correct_answers: Customer should rotate the access keys regularly.

question:
A Cloud Engineer expects an increase in application traffic at a particular time when the application Go-Live
is planned. How can the-Cloud Engineer ensure Amazon EC2 Auto scaling allocates the desired number of
EC2 instances ahead of Go-Live?
—=> A. Configure a/scheduled scaling Policy.
; B. Configure a Target tracking scaling Policy.
options: Configure a/scheduled scaling Policy. ; Configure a Target tracking scaling Policy.
explanation: fittps://docs.aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/ec2/userguide/as-scale-based-on-demand.html - _ — / Don’t forget to » ( Subscribe the } Channel y i ai a -
correct_answers: Configure a/scheduled scaling Policy. ; Configure a Target tracking scaling Policy.

question:
Which of the following are recommended security measures when Creating access to an AWS account?
(Choose two)
> A. Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
: B. Grant Admin Privilege access
options: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) : Grant Admin Privilege access
explanation: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html
correct_answers: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) : Grant Admin Privilege access

question:
A Cloud Engineer is required to retain data for seven years in order to comply with regulatory standards.
Which AWS service meets this need for the LEAST amount of money?
explanation: The Glacier Deep Archive storage class is designed to provide durable and secure long-term storage for large amounts of data at a price that is competitive with off-premises tape archival services. Data is stored across 3 or more AWS Availability Zones and it provides two retrieval options ranging from 12-48 hours.

question: Which if the following should be provided by users to. utilize the AWS CLI?
explanation: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/cli-configure-quickstart.html

question: Which of the following statements most accurately characterizes Elastic Load Balancing?
options: It collects metrics of connected Amazon EC2 instances. > Itdistributes incoming application traffic across one or more Amazon EC2 instances.
It translates}a domain name into an IP address using DNS
It automatically adjusts the number of Amazon EC2 instances to support incoming traffic.
explanation: Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets and virtual appliances in one or more Availability Zones (AZs). a https://aws.amazon:com/elasticloadbalancing/ y Don’t forget to 4 Subscribe the ] , Channel / ™ <a _ a
correct_answers: It translates}a domain name into an IP address using DNS

question:
Acorporationis developing a mobile application to give its clients with shopping suggestions. The business
intends to include agraph database into the shopping recommendation engine. Which AWS database
service should the business use ?

~> = A. Amazon Neptune
explanation: Amazon Neptune is a fully managed database service built for the cloud that makes it easier to build. and run graph applications. Neptune provides built-in security, continuous backups, serverless compute, and integrations with other AWS services. https://aws.amazon.com/neptune/

question:
Which DynamoDB feature can be used to reduce the latency of requests to a database from milliseconds to
microseconds?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) is a fully managed, highly available, in- memory cache for Amazon DynamoDB that delivers up to a 10 times performance improvement—from milliseconds to microseconds—even at millions of requests per second. DAX does all the-heavy lifting required to add in-memory acceleration to your DynamoDB tables, without requiring developers to manage cache invalidation, data population, or cluster management. (Me oe ee ee ae eg a a en a fe oe aero

question:
Which of the following is the most appropriate means for developers to store Docker container images in the
AWS Cloud?
explanation: Amazon ECR is a fully managed container registry offering high-performance hosting, so you can reliably deploy application images and artifacts anywhere. https://aws.arvazon.com/ecr/

question: Which AWS Service can be used to send alerts based on Amazon CloudWatch alarms?
explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) sends notifications two ways, A2A (Application to Application) and A2P (Application to Person). A2A provides high-throughput, push-based, many- to-many messaging between distributed systems, microservices, and event-driven serverless applications. These applications include Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS), Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose, AWS Lambda, and other HTTPS endpoints. A2P functionality lets you send messages to your customers with SMS texts, push notifications, and email.

question:
Which AWS hybrid'storage service enables on-premise applications to seamlessly use AWS Cloud Storage
through standard file storage protocols?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a set of hybrid cloud storage services that provide on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage. https://aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/

question: Which statement is true in relation to data stored within an AWS Region?
options: Data is not replicated outside of a region unless you configure it
Data is always automatically replicated to at least one other availability zone
Data is always replicated to another region
explanation: Data stored within an AWS region is not replicated outside of that region automatically. It is up to customers of AWS to determine whether they want to replicate their data to other regions. You must always consider compliance and network latency when making this decision.
correct_answers: Data is not replicated outside of a region unless you configure it

question: Which team is available to support AWS customers on an Enterprise support plan with account issues?
explanation: Concierge Team are AWS billing and account experts that specialize in working with enterprise accounts and are Included as part of the Enterprise Support plan

question: Which AWS Service lets you add user sign up, sign-in and access control to web and mobile apps?
explanation: With Amazon Cognito, you can add user sign-up and sign-in features and control access to your web and mobile applications. Amazon Cognito provides an identity store that scales to millions of users, supports social and enterprise identity federation, and offers advanced security features to.protect your consumers and business. Built on open identity standards, Amazon Cognito supports various compliance regulations and integrates with frontend and backend development resources. httns://aws amazon com/cognito/

question:
What is the main benefit of the principle of ‘loose coupling’?
» A. Reduce interdependencies so a failure in one component does not cascade to
other/ components.
options: Reduce interdependencies so a failure in one component does not cascade to other/ components.
Enables applications to scale automatically based on current demand.
Automate the deployment of infrastructure using code.
explanation: Loose coupling enables you to add additional code or features to a component while minimizing risk to components that depend on it. Limiting interconnections can help isolate problems when things go wrong and simplify testing, maintenance and troubleshooting procedures.
correct_answers: Reduce interdependencies so a failure in one component does not cascade to other/ components.

question:

question:

large amounts of online video content withleast possible latency
(Choose| two)?
explanation: CloudFront speeds up content delivery by leveraging its global network of data centers, known as edge locations, to reduce delivery time by caching your content close to your end users. CloudFront fetches your content from an origin, such as an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance, an Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) load balancer, or your own web server, when it's not already in an edge location

question:

of data storage. Which AWS Service is best option in this case?
explanation: Amazon EFS file systems can automatically scale from gigabytes to petabytes of data without needing to provision storage. Tens, hundreds, or even thousands of compute instances can access an Amazon EFS file system at the same time, and Amazon EFS provides consistent performance to each compute instance. Amazon EFS is designed to be highly durable and highly available. With Amazon EFS, there is no minimum fee or setup costs, and you pay only for what you use.

question:

AWS CloudFormation makes the changes to your stack only when you decide to execute the change set, allowing you to decide whether to proceed with your proposed changes or explore other changes by creating another change set.

You're designing a global application that requires low-latency search
capabilities. How can you achieve this using-Amazon CloudSearch?
options: Deploy Amazon CloudSearch in a single region closest to the majority of users.
Deploy Amazon-CloudSearch in multiple regions and use Amazon Route 53 latency-based routing.
Use Amazon CloudFront to cache search results from a single search domain.
Deploy Amazon CloudSearch with a cross-region replication setup.
correct_answers: Deploy Amazon-CloudSearch in multiple regions and use Amazon Route 53 latency-based routing.

Which of the following is the best practice to consider while designing your
service Architecture?
options: Build a single application component that can handle all the application functionality.
Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.
Make large changes on fewer iterations to reduce chances of failure
correct_answers: Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.

question: How does the scale of cloud computing help you to save costs?
options: You can quickly deploy applications to customers and provide them with low latency. ~~ Accessing services on-demand helps to prevent excess or limited capacity.
You don/t have to invest in technology resources before using them
The aggregated cloud usage from a large number of customers results in lower pay-as-you-go pricing.
correct_answers: You don/t have to invest in technology resources before using them
